{"step_by_step_thinking": "According to the relevant documents, the adoption of Department of Health (DH) guidance on gynaecological cancer, which included centralisation of care and multidisciplinary management, resulted in a marked improvement in survival of gynaecological cancer in the Anglia region of England. The survival rates for cases diagnosed between 1996 and 1999 were broadly the same, but there was a marked improvement in survival from 2000 onwards. The improvement in survival was not attenuated by adjustment for treatments or method of case follow-up. Therefore, based on the evidence provided, the answer is A. yes, the improvements in survival of gynaecological cancer in the Anglia region of England are an effect of centralisation of care and use of multidisciplinary management.", "answer_choice": "A"}
